name: You, Always
description:
A portrait of sisterhood.

In the wake of shocking news, sisters Liz and Delia unravel a lifetime of memories, traveling across space and time to trace the push and pull of their relationship over their fifty-year shared history with humour, nuance, and candor. This is an ode to sisterhood, to the brutal honesty, raucous silliness, and unflinching support of an indispensable sibling.  

This new play by Governor General's Award-winning playwright Erin Shields was developed as part of Canadian Stage's New Work Development Program. Directed by Nightwood Theatre Artistic Director Andrea Donaldson, this stunning new play strikes a universal chord.

name: Soledad Barrio and Noche Flamenca: Searching for Goya

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description:
Choreographed by Bessie Award-winning principal dancer Soledad Barrio and artistic director Mart√≠n Santangelo, the extraordinary paintings of Francisco de Goya are brought to life through the language of flamenco dance, vocals, and guitar.

Under the direction and choreography of Santangelo, the award-winning Noche Flamenca is recognized as one the world's premier touring companies. 

Formed in 1993 by Santangelo and his wife and principal dancer, Soledad Barrio, the company has toured throughout the globe, including regular seasons in New York City, and performances in North and South America, Europe, and Australia. 

Hailed by critics for its transcendent and deeply emotional performances, Noche Flamenca has successfully brought to the stage the essence, purity, and integrity of one of the world's most complex and mysterious art forms, through a diverse theatrical body of work that expresses a rigorous, spell-binding aesthetic that exceeds the highest artistic expectations.

name: The Glenn Gould School Vocal Showcase

location.name: Koerner Hall, Royal Conservatory of Music

description: Come watch our talented voice students present an evening of art songs and opera excerpts.

name: Being and Becoming: Annual Public Philosophy Social
description:
An evening of meaningful conversations and community for those seeking connection with others through dialogue and shared exploration. 

For the past two years, we've been organizing in-person conversations about love, morality, humour, AI, forgiveness, democracy, consciousness, and more. Once a year, we come together for a big social that welcomes anyone who enjoys exploring ideas, questions, and experiences with others in a more spontaneous (and perhaps also serendipitous) way than our usual programming. 

Join us to meet friends, spark conversations about questions big and small, and celebrate two years of being and becoming curious together. Come solo or bring a friend!

name: WonderPhil the Magician
description:
Watching as WonderPhil creates the perfect balance of amazement and laughs to keep everyone entertained from beginning to end. 

After the show, adults and kids alike will be scratching their heads with wonder! His pet parrot Ha-Ha may stop in for a surprise visit too!

A1 Media has called him "the best magician in Toronto". Don't miss out!

name: Up in Jokes Toronto Comedy Show
description:
Taking comedy to a higher level! 

Featuring a lineup of hilarious comedians who know how to bring the laughs, this show promises non-stop fun, clever punchlines, and a night filled with joy. Whether you're flying high or keeping it chill, this comedy show has got you covered!

name: You Do You
description:
Join us in welcoming our newest Artists' Network Members. 

Get ready to meet fresh and new perspectives, and discover a new favourite artist.
